an5.175:4.1: “Mendicants, a lay follower with five qualities is an outcaste, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.
an5.175:4.5: They practice noisy, superstitious rites, believing in omens rather than deeds.
an5.175:4.6: They seek outside of the Buddhist community for teachers worthy of offerings.
an5.175:4.7: And they make offerings there first.
an5.175:4.8: A lay follower with these five qualities is an outcaste, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.
an5.175:5.1: A lay follower with five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.
an5.175:5.5: They don’t practice noisy, superstitious rites, and believe in deeds rather than omens.
an5.175:5.6: They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for teachers worthy of offerings.
an5.175:5.7: And they don’t make offerings there first.
an5.175:5.8: A lay follower with these five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.’
